page.title: 16BRAFIELD ... the past.
page.content: In the Domesday Book Brafield is referred to as{BRACHEFIELD}or {BRAGEFELDE. Its history goes back to the days when William the Conqueror gave 3 virgates of land (approx. 90 acres) to his niece{Countess Judith. Subsequently, Norman Knights became Lords of the Manor. In Medieval times the church of St. Laurence was passed to the Crown. From 1838-1894 the Lord of the Manor was also the vicar of the Parish Church. He spent freely on the church and erected the village school close by. Brafield was once described as the {roughest village}in Northamptonshire. It gained this infamous reputation during the "Cottage Industry" days of the boot and shoe industry. Fights in the local public house were regular affairs on pay days.
